2:
For they will soon dry up as the grass
\q and wither as the green plants.
4:
Then delight yourself in Yahweh,
\q and he will give you the desires of your heart.
6:
He will display your justice like the daylight
\q and your innocence like the day at noon.
7:
Be still before Yahweh and wait patiently for him.
\q Do not be angry if someone succeeds in what he does,
\q or when he makes evil plots.
8:
Do not be angry and frustrated.
\q Do not worry. This only makes trouble.
\q
9:
Evildoers will be cut off,
\q but those who wait for Yahweh will inherit the land.
\q
10:
In a little while the evil man will disappear;
\q you will look at his place, but he will be gone.
11:
But the meek will inherit the land
\q and will delight in great prosperity.
\q
12:
The wicked man plots against the righteous
\q and gnashes his teeth against him.
\q
13:
The Lord laughs at him,
\q for he sees that his day is coming.
14:
The wicked have drawn out their swords and have bent their bows
\q to cast down the oppressed and needy,
\q to kill those who are upright.
\q
15:
Their swords will pierce their own hearts,
\q and their bows will be broken.
16:
Better is the little that the righteous has
\q than the abundance of many wicked people.
\q
17:
For the arms of the wicked people will be broken,
\q but Yahweh supports the righteous people.
18:
Yahweh watches over the blameless day by day,
\q and their heritage will be forever.
\q
19:
They will not be ashamed when times are bad.
\q When famine comes, they will have enough to eat.
20:
But evil men will perish.
\q Yahweh's enemies will be like the glory of the pastures;
\q they will be consumed and disappear in the smoke.
\q
21:
The wicked person borrows but does not repay,
\q but the righteous person is generous and gives.
23:
It is by Yahweh that a man's steps are established,
\q the man whose way is commendable in God's sight.
\q
24:
Though he stumbles, he will not fall down,
\q for Yahweh is holding him with his hand.
25:
I was young and now am old;
\q I have never seen the righteous person abandoned
\q or his children begging for bread.
\q
26:
All the day long he is gracious and lends,
\q and his children become a blessing.
\q
27:
Turn away from evil and do what is right;
\q then you will be safe forever.
28:
For Yahweh loves justice
\q and does not abandon his faithful followers.
\q They are preserved forever,
\q but the descendants of the wicked will be cut off.
\q
29:
The righteous will inherit the land
\q and live there forever.
\q
30:
The mouth of the righteous person speaks wisdom
\q and increases justice.
32:
The wicked person watches the righteous person
\q and seeks to kill him.
\q
33:
Yahweh will not abandon him into the evil person's hand
\q or condemn him when he is judged.
34:
Wait for Yahweh and keep his way,
\q and he will raise you up to possess the land.
\q You will see when the wicked are cut off.
35:
I have seen the wicked and terrifying person
\q spread out like a green tree in its native soil.
\q
36:
But when I passed by again, he was not there.
\q I looked for him, but he could not be found.
38:
Sinners will be totally destroyed;
\q the future for the wicked man is cut off.
40:
Yahweh helps them and rescues them.
\q He rescues them from evil men and saves them
\q because they have taken refuge in him.
